dataset.title: Groundwater Levels on Hog Island, VA. 2007-

address.deliveryPoint: UVA, Department of Environmental Sciences, 291 McCormick Road, P.O. Box 400123
Old Dominion University, Department of Biological Sciences

metadataProvider.organizationName: Virginia Coast Reserve Long-Term Ecological Research Project

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Environmental Sciences, University of Virginia, 291 McCormick Road, PO Box 400123

abstract.para: This dataset contains hourly measurements of groundwater levels on Hog Island, VA - off the Atlantic Coast of the Delmarva Peninsula. It continues measurements of groundwater levels that were initiated in by Frank Day in July 1990 (dataset VCR99066) and by Mark Brinson in October 1997 (dataset VCR05130). Refer to these datasets for previous measurements. The groundwater measurements use the same wells and locations, but differ in sensor technology and frequency of measurement.
In August 2007, a system of wirelessly-connected data loggers designed by Thomas Williams was installed with help from Arthur Schwarzschild, Chris Buck, John Hayward and John Porter.

listitem.para: Figure showing well locations and connecting trails) URL=http://www.vcrlter.virginia.edu/graphics/Well_locations_and_trails.jpg

The UVA grants you (hereafter, Licensee) a license to use the data and documentation for academic, and research purposes only, without a fee.
Licensee may make derivative works. However, if Licensee distributes any derivative work based on or derived from the data and documentation, then Licensee will

listitem.para: notify the VCR/LTER designated contact (typically the investigator who collected the data) regarding its distribution of the derivative work, and
clearly notify users that such derivative work is a modified version and not the original data and documentation distributed by the UVA.
acknowledge the support of NSF Grants BSR-8702333-06, DEB-9211772, DEB-9411974, DEB-0080381, DEB-0621014 and DEB-1237733 in any publications using the data and documentation.
send to the address, above, two reprints of any publications resulting from use of the data and documentation.

section.para: Any Licensee wishing to make commercial use of the data and documentation should contact the UVA, c/o VCR/LTER, to negotiate an appropriate license for such commercial use. Commercial use includes

listitem.para: integration of all or part of the data and documentation into a product for sale or license by or on behalf of Licensee to third parties, or
distribution of the data or documentation to third parties that need it to utilize a commercial product sold or licensed by or on behalf of Licensee.

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Environmental Sciences, University of Virginia, 291 McCormick Road, PO Box 400123

description.para: Measurements are taken by a Campbell Scientific CS-450 or equivalent pressure sensor with atmospheric equilibration and logged on a Campbell Scientific CR-206 data logger. Measurements are taken every 15 minutes and average, max and minimum values are reported each hour.

Data is downloaded several times each day by Campbell Scientific "Loggernet" software to a PC and then transferred to a Unix computer where a SAS program integrates the new data with previous data, calculates elevations relative to surface and mean sea level and produces the output file. A copy of the SAS job is listed below:
/* BASIC SAS PROGRAM FOR READING VCR-LTER WATER LEVEL RECORDER DATA
THIS VERSION READS RAW FILES FROM THE DATA LOGGER AND DOES ERROR
CHECKS FOR DATA STREAMS FROM CAMPBELL DATA LOGGERS
* if a NEW year, also see commented SET statement down below;
%let _EFIERR_ = 0; /* set the ERROR detection macro variable */
infile 'NEWDATA.DAT' delimiter = ',' MISSOVER DSD lrecl=32767 firstobs=2 ;
if _ERROR_ then call symputx('_EFIERR_',1); /* set ERROR
* keep only valid dates and dates in the current year;
label elevmsl='Water Elevation above MSL - meters';
label elevsur='Water Elevation above ground surface - meters';
label DATE_TIME='Date and Time of Measurement';
label DATE_TIME_MIN='Date and Time of Minimum Level within hour';
label DATE_TIME_MAX='Date and Time of Maximum Level within hour';
label Height_Avg='Raw height of water above sensor - meters';
label Sensor_errors = 'Num. Sensor Errors per hour';
label Maint_flag= 'Maintenance flag - logger door open';
/* delete record with wildly out of range values */
/*now merge the good records into the yearly file */
title1 'Data records with wildly out of range data';
title1 'Data records with no wildly out of range values';
data junk; /* a non-empty data set in case lib.wlr&year is empty */
data olddata; /*combine datasets to create new non-empty dataset*/
set lib.wlr&year junk; /* uncomment this line for normal operations within a year */
* SET junk; /* Uncomment this line to begin a new year */
/* update olddata newhour; by ID DATE_TIME; */
* delete duplicate records - assume same if ID, DATE_TIME and elevmsl match;
/* if ((lag(ID) eq ID) and (lag(DATE_TIME) EQ DATE_TIME)
proc sort data=lib.wlr&year nodupkey; by id date_time elevmsl;
data _null_; /*print out a new text file containing the data */
put 'n,stationname,location, datelev, time, elevmsl, elevsur, HeightAvg, Sensorerrors, Maintflag' ;
put _N_ ',"' Station_name '","' Location '", ' date ', ' time ', ' elevmsl ', ' elevsur
put 'station date Volts Tcode Height_Avg Height_Min Height_Max' ;
* use only the last 21 days for the status data ;
put _n_ ',"' station_name '",' date ',' time ',' exceldate 12.2 ',' Int_VDC_min ',' Sensor_errors ',' Main
t_flag ',' Data_retries ',' Trouble_Flag_TotCode ',' Height_Avg ',' Height_Min ',' Height_Max ',' RSSI_Min '
put _n_ ',"' station_name '",' date ',' time ',' exceldate 12.2 ',' Int_VDC_min ',' Sensor_errors ',' Main
t_flag ',' Data_retries ',' Trouble_Flag_TotCode ',' Height_Avg ',' Height_Min ',' Height_Max ',' RSSI_Min '
/* proc sort data=status; by station_name date_time;
var Int_VDC_min Sensor_errors Maint_flag Data_retries RSSI_min;

dataTable.entityDescription: Groundwater Levels on Hog Island, VA. 2007-

attribute.attributeLabel: Elevation of water surface above mean sea level
attribute.attributeDefinition: ELEVMSL - Elevation of water surface above mean sea level

attribute.attributeLabel: Elevation of water surface relative to local land surface
attribute.attributeDefinition: ELEVSUR - Elevation of water surface relative to local land surface

description.para: Negative numbers indicate that the water level is below the surrounding land surface.

attribute.attributeLabel: Raw height measurement relative to sensor in the well
attribute.attributeDefinition: HEIGHTAVG - Raw height measurement relative to sensor in the well

description.para: Four measurements were taken each hour (one every 15 minutes). This is the average of those four measurements and is used, along with measurements of the elevations of the wells themselves to calculate elevmsl and elevsur.

attribute.attributeLabel: Count of number of reported sensor errors
attribute.attributeDefinition: SENSORERRORS - Count of number of reported sensor errors

description.para: Number of out-of-range values reported by the data logger during the hour. These values are not used in the computation of the hourly average. Number of valid readings in an hour is 4 minus the number of sensor errors.

codeDefinition.definition: No maintenance was performed on the logger or sensor during measurements
Maintenance of logger was performed during one or more measurements

description.para: A light sensor attached to the data logger detects when the door of the enclosure is opened for maintenance. The door is typically also left open during servicing of the sensor. Maintenance may, or may not, affect operation of the system.
